body.p: Paragraph 39(b) requires an entity to disclose a quantitative maturity analysis for derivative financial liabilities that shows remaining contractual maturities if the contractual maturities are essential for an understanding of the timing of the cash flows. For example, this would be the case for:

li.p: an interest rate swap with a remaining maturity of five years in a cash flow hedge of a variable rate financial asset or liability.
